text:
I have a table of data being displayed on a page from HubDB and it’s using “&orderBy=-name”. This works just fine and displays the data alphabetically. HOWEVER, in Firefox, the data is displayed in reverse. Just Firefox. I have no idea why FF would read this differently.

If I use “name” instead of “-name” for the ordering, everything reverses… including FF. So FF is now displaying correctly, but everything else is now Z-A instead of A-Z. Ideas anyone??
thats weird. Can u DM the page or template links i will dig more

I am going to create a website that contains a HubDB which has events. These events have a maximum capacity of how many people can attend the event. We are going to create a HubSpot form for people to reserve a spot in the event. I would like to update a column in the HubDB whenever a form submission has been made to make sure we never go over the maximum capacity.
Has anyone found a way to update a HubDB field based on a form submission? I couldn't find a workflow or script to do this.
